title: Winpe NTDetect Failed, if the kernel image format is "img"

forumNotes.author: regname
forumNotes.content:
I made MicroPE could run from ram with ramdisk.sys or firadisk with grub4dos, and the kernel image format is "ISO", it runs well. But If I use the "img" image format,it will have a error that the ntdetect failed. though I use the same structure, the same file, I only changed the kernel image "iso" to "img". The img file I created with three steps: 1.. Create img file with VDM(virtual drive manager) 2.. Mount the img file and then format it with fat32 or ntfs 3.. Copy MicroPE files to the img.
This is the kernel image stucture: -- / ---- MXPE ------ SYSTEM32 The grub4dos menu.lst: ; Boot Failed title IMG Kernel map --mem /!OS/MXPE.img (hd0) map --hook chainloader (hd0,0)/MXPE/SETUPLDR.BIN rootnoverify (hd0) boot ; title WINPE map --mem /!OS/MXPE.iso.gz (hd32) map --hook root (hd32) chainloader /MXPE/SETUPLDR.BIN boot The SETUPLDR.BIN I already cracked, no self-check, and replaced "i386" to "MXPE". Everything is welll except that while boot with grub4dos map --mem command and the kernel image format is "img", it will have ntdetect failed error.
Who could give me some advices or solutions? Thanks. #### Attached Thumbnails {#attach_wrap} * [![1.jpg](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261210329_thumb.jpg)](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261210329.jpg "1.jpg - Size: 7.15KB"){#ipb-attach-url-10124-0-91950600-1676066677} * [![2.jpg](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261211490_thumb.jpg)](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261211490.jpg "2.jpg - Size: 34.31KB"){#ipb-attach-url-10125-0-91959400-1676066677} * [![3.jpg](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261211497_thumb.jpg)](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261211497.jpg "3.jpg - Size: 9.46KB"){#ipb-attach-url-10126-0-91965600-1676066677} * [![4.jpg](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261211503_thumb.jpg)](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261211503.jpg "4.jpg - Size: 34.96KB"){#ipb-attach-url-10127-0-91970300-1676066677}

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Instead of VDM, try using MBRBATCH/MKIMG or hdimage: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=3191](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=3191 "External link") [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=9033](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=9033 "External link")
If you create an image and mount it in VDM and format it "as is" it will have NO MBR: it will be a "superfloppy", i.e. a non partitioned drive. Thus (hd0***,0*** ) makes no sense. But from what you report your drive looks fine. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) But you used tewo different sets of command, like (hd0+1). ![:merc:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/merc.gif) ![:merc:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/merc.gif) jaclaz

forumNotes.author: was_JFX
forumNotes.content:
NTDetect Failed means usually that setupldr couldn't find ntdetect.com.  
Did you put ntdetect.com inside mxpe folder and replaced the /i386/ntdetect.com with /mxpe/ntdetect.com in setupldr.bin?  

If so you may found a scenario where the merged setupldr is needed.  

![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

forumNotes.author: regname
forumNotes.content:
> NTDetect Failed means usually that setupldr couldn't find ntdetect.com.  
> Did you put ntdetect.com inside mxpe folder and replaced the /i386/ntdetect.com with /mxpe/ntdetect.com in setupldr.bin?  
>
> If so you may found a scenario where the merged setupldr is needed.  
>
> ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)

Yes, I was replaced the /i386/ntdetect.com with /mxpe/ntdetect.com in setupldr.bin.  

I had read a topic about how to merge ntdetect into setupldr.bin, but I can not understand, like that use ultraedit find text "MZ", cut "MZ" and some data after it, I don't know what the some data is.  

Do you know how to do that?  
Could you teach me?  

Thanks.

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Yes, I was replaced the /i386/ntdetect.com with /mxpe/ntdetect.com in setupldr.bin. OK, we found the problem (maybe ![:merc:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/merc.gif)) BEFORE changing /i386/ to mxpe, you need to change /minint/ to /i386/: [http://www.911cd.net...showtopic=17504](http://www.911cd.net/forums//index.php?showtopic=17504 "External link") In other words, the SETUPLDR.BIN uses TWO different paths: * /i386/ on CD and (probably ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif)) super-floppy * /minint/ on Hard Disk and partitioned devices
It is possible that you changed one (and not the other) to /mxpe/. ![:merc:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/merc.gif) jaclaz

forumNotes.content:

> > If you create an image and mount it in VDM and format it "as is" it will have NO MBR: it will be a "superfloppy", i.e. a non partitioned drive. > Thus (hd0***,0*** ) makes no sense. > But from what you report your drive looks fine. :wink: > > But you used tewo different sets of command, like (hd0+1). ![:merc:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/merc.gif) > > ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) > > jaclaz What should I do? you mean that export the mbr to a file first,and then write it to img? I am downloading an img kernel MicroPE in another forum, I will turn the img image over my mind.

2. Keep all "i386", just do others modify.  

But the both ways failed.  

MARK: I till no write mbr to image. And if kernnel image format is "iso", it runs well if no boot sector and use the same way of load img.(i.e chainloader /MXPE/SETUPLDR.BIN)

forumNotes.author: regname

Now I could make run with grub4dos map mem command, and no ntdetect failed error. \[Just copy ntdetect.com and setupldr.bin to root directory, why could not find and load them automatically like boot from ISO? Maybe could get it by crack.\]

and I had wrote mbr to the partition image. but a new error came, have a stop error while boot after showed windows xp logo. #### Attached Thumbnails {#attach_wrap} * [![1.jpg](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261289651_thumb.jpg)](http://reboot.pro/uploads/monthly_12_2009/post-27606-1261289651.jpg "1.jpg - Size: 52.48KB"){#ipb-attach-url-10133-0-91975000-1676066677}

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Learn to do things in steps. DO NOT modify ANY file. Use a "standard" SETUPLDR.BIN. Get the .iso that is working. Mount the HD image. Copy all files from the .iso to the .img. Rename the \\MXPE\\ directory to \\minint\\. Copy to the ROOT of the image: * SETUPLDR.BIN \<- an UNMODIFIED copy * NTDETECT.COM * WINNT.SIF
Edit WINNT.SIF to reflect the changes. Post your current WINNT.SIF if you have problems. (most probably from what you report you have at least a wrong or missing WINNT.SIF and you are NOT loadting the image through RAMDISK) :wink: jaclaz

forumNotes.author: regname
forumNotes.content:
> Learn to do things in steps. > > DO NOT modify ANY file. Use a "standard" SETUPLDR.BIN. > Get the .iso that is working. > Mount the HD image. > Copy all files from the .iso to the .img. > Rename the \\MXPE\\ directory to \\minint\\. > Copy to the ROOT of the image: > > * SETUPLDR.BIN \<- an UNMODIFIED copy > * NTDETECT.COM > * WINNT.SIF > >
> > Edit WINNT.SIF to reflect the changes. > > Post your current WINNT.SIF if you have problems. > > (most probably from what you report you have at least a wrong or missing WINNT.SIF and you are NOT loadting the image through RAMDISK) > > :wink: > > jaclaz > >
>
Still failed that boot with same standard files and rename /MXPE or /I386 to /minint from HD img, coursed by the same problem like before. I could run MicroPE in ram with Microsoft RAMDISK driver and HD image, but because of that I wanna put the image file to second level directory or more levels, and grub4dos could emulate a img to be a disk from any directory if it can access, so I used map mem command. Of course, I could use ISO and RAMDISK.SYS, but I want to try and use img format without RAMDISK.SYS. So, I had disabled this driver. If I use RAMDISK.SYS, it will run well I know, but I will counld not customize the diretory struture with what I hope. Do u have some advices to me? Did

forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
> Do u have some advices to me? Well, this it's an easy one. ![:cheers:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/cheers.gif) If you use RAMDISK.SYS (or grub4dos+firadisk.sys, or grub4dos+winvblock.sys) or any other driver that works, it will work, otherwise you will get a BSOD with STOP 0x0000007b. I cannot understand WHAT the heck you are trying to do :cool:: > I could run MicroPE in ram with Microsoft RAMDISK driver and HD image, but because of that I wanna put the image file to second level directory or more levels, and grub4dos could emulate a img to be a disk from any directory if it can access, so I used map mem command. I don't understand what is the problem with levels, there are no "level limits" that I can think of. ![:merc:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/merc.gif) I fear you are trying to do with .img exactly what I try to avoid with .iso, read attentively this: [http://www.boot-land...?showtopic=8944](http://www.boot-land.net/forums/index.php?showtopic=8944 "External link") substituting ".iso" with ".img".
:wink: jaclaz

forumNotes.author: regname
